description.en: The course gives an overview of the interrelations between measurements and economy: In macro level: National Measurement infrastructure, its economic effects, the main macroeconomic indicators in the main markets: money market, labour market, public sector. In Micro level: Costs of measurements and their estimation in firm level, investments, the principles of accountings and household theory.
description.et: Kursus annab ülevaate mõõtmiste tähtsusest majanduses nii makro- kui ka mikromajanduslikust aspektist vaadates. Makromajanduslik osa: riigi mõõtesüsteem ja selle kasulikkus riigile majandusanalüüsi põhjal. Olulisemad makromajanduslikud indikaatorid erinevatel turgudel: rahaturg, tööturg, avaliku sektori majandus Mikromajanduslik osa: mõõtmiste ja analüüside hind, arvestuse alused, firma ja majapidamisteooria, investeeringud.

objectives.en: This course consists from two parts. The first part gives an outline of theoretical models concerning economy on micro-level. In the second part the course gives an overview of recent trends of globalisation, global changes in finance, commodity and labour markets and their influence to Estonian economy.
objectives.et: Kursus koosneb kahest osast. Esimeses osas antakse ülevaade majandust mikrotasandil kirjeldavatest ja analüüsivatest teoreetilistest mudelitest. Teises osas antakse teadmisi ettevõtte tegevust mõjutavast makroökonoomilisest keskkonnast, kasutades selleks nii Eesti majanduse kui globaalse maailmamajanduse näiteid

description.et: The final score is formed at written examination. The questions of examination cover all topics of the class. The evaluation is statistical: the student will receive 5 questions. Every question has been assigned a weight and they will be separately evaluated using a 10-point system. For estimation of knowledge of concepts their understanding, ability of construction of conclusions and knowledge of the facts is considered.

grade_preconditions.et: All students are admitted to exam.

grade_evaluation.et:
The examination final score is formed on the basis of three components
80% final exam
20% group work

Final scores are converted to the mark using the classical scheme: 50-59 E; 60-69 D; 70-79 C; 80-89 B; 90-100 A. If the result falls exactly on the borderline then the higher mark is used.

assessment_scale.et: Eristav (A, B, C, D, E, F, mi)
assessment_scale.en: differentiated (A, B, C, D, E, F, not present)

4. Franz Hengstberger The Economic Impact of Metrology, 2010

description.et:
--1-- Some economic principles
Divison of labor, specialization, supply, demand, elasticity, prices, costs, ...
We will try to link with measurements
In a number of cases we will find answers by discussing
--2-- Economic aspects of measurements at company level
Costs involved in measurements, quality requirements for measurements, estimating costs, ...
We will carry out calculations
--3-- Economic aspects of measurement infrastructure
What does the society need for supporting reliable measurements
--4-- Group work
Helping a water production company
